intro: Benstonea platystigma, commonly known as the broad-stemmed benstonea, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, which are typically borne on long peduncles. Its leaves are usually ovate to elliptic in shape and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Benstonea platystigma is often found in tropical forests, where it thrives in humid and shaded environments.
